critique: This document establishes procedures for coordination and resolution of differences of opinion between the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency and other affected Government agencies concerning all significant aspects of arms control and disarmament policy and related matters. It aims to coordinate arms control and disarmament policy, research, public information dissemination, international negotiations, and control systems. The document itself doesn't directly reflect ideological leanings, immigration policies, or social inclusion. It focuses on national security and international relations. It centralizes authority for arms control within the federal government. It doesn't obviously expand executive power, but clarifies the role of the Director of the United States Arms Control and Disarmament Agency. It also doesn't directly regulate the economy.
